title.narrative: 2.2. QUALITY FOUNDATION, INTERMEDIATE AND SENIOR PHASE LEARNING

description.narrative: National and subnational education systems have enhanced capacities to deliver inclusive, equitable and quality basic education for learners in the foundation, intermediate and senior phases., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from inclusive, gender-sensitive quality learning and developmental services in both the home and school environments.

sector.narrative: Digital learning materials and ICT in education

Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

related-activity.ref: 3930/A0/05/882 OUTCOME2: EARLY CHILDHOOD-, PRIMARY-, SECONDARY-AGE EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and subnational education systems have enhanced capacities to deliver inclusive, equitable and quality basic education forlearners in the foundation, intermediate and senior phases.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported programmes reached at least 5,740,951 children.; Concrete steps to making the education sector more accountable was achieved with the revision of the Framework for Curriculum Implementation (FCI).; Positively impacting reading proficiency, the Early Grade Reading Programme (EGRP) implementation continued in North West province.; To date, 140 schools and 690 teachers have been trained and all planned resources distributed to schools. Towards the emergency response, UNICEF supported interventions have reached at least 4,961,506 children, 764,471 teachers, 1,889,057 parents accessing learning materials and Handwashing stations were constructed in 151 schools. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/01/2022
